result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: The photocatalytic activity of the prepared catalysts was evaluated by the photoreduction of CO 2 in the absence of cocatalysts and sacrificial agents.Fig. 2a andb show the time-course generation of CO and CH 4 produced by photoreduction of CO 2 over CNAu, CN1, and CN0.The yields of CO and CH 4 over all the prepared catalysts increased with time, and CNAu showed the most significant increase in the yield of CO and CH 4 .Fig. 2c andd present the evolution rates of CO and CH 4 over the prepared samples.CN1

Light Labsolar 6A).Briefly, 30 mg sample and 3 mL ethanol were placed in a shallow dish and sonicated for 5 min.Then, 0.5 mL deionized water was added after drying.Prior to the introduction of CO 2 , the closed glass reactor was vacuumed to remove air.Gas chromatography (FULI 979011) was used to detect the product of photoreduction of CO 2 every 30 min. The characteristics of transient photocurrent response and electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS) of the samples under Xe lamp irradiation were tested on

with scanning range of 250-800 nm.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was performed using Axis Supra.Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) images were captured using FEI Inspect F50 (FSEM).Time-resolved photoluminescence (TRPL) was tested using FLSP920 (Edinburgh instrument) under an excitation wavelength of 375 nm and emission wavelength of 460 nm. Under the Xe lamp irradiation, the photoreduction of CO 2 was completed using a photocatalytic online analysis system (Perfect Light Labsolar 6A).Briefly, 30

surrounding electrons through electronelectron or electron-phonon scattering, which activates the surrounding electrons and causes the local temperature rise 46.As shown in step 2, the hot electrons transferred energy to the electrons transferred from g-C 3 N 4 to the Au nanoparticles.The electrons were captured by the adsorbed CO 2 molecules and reacted with the H 2 O molecules present in the environment to generate CO and CH 4 (step 3).The activation of hot electrons increased the efficiency of
the enhanced photocatalytic activity for CO 2 reduction under visible-light irradiation.

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: Light Labsolar 6A).Briefly, 30 mg sample and 3 mL ethanol were placed in a shallow dish and sonicated for 5 min.Then, 0.5 mL deionized water was added after drying.Prior to the introduction of CO 2 , the closed glass reactor was vacuumed to remove air.Gas chromatography (FULI 979011) was used to detect the product of photoreduction of CO 2 every 30 min. The characteristics of transient photocurrent response and electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS) of the samples under Xe lamp irradiation were tested on

lamp irradiation were tested on an electrochemical workstation CHI660E (Shanghai Chenhua Co., Ltd., China) equipped with a three-electrode system.AgAgCl and Pt wire were used as reference and counter electrodes, respectively.The working electrode was prepared as follows: 30 mg polyethylene glycol and 30 mg sample were mixed and ground with 0.5 mL ethanol.The resulting slurry was coated on a conductive glass with a coating area of 1 cm 2 and then dried at 100 C for 2 h.The electrolyte was 0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 .

with scanning range of 250-800 nm.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was performed using Axis Supra.Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) images were captured using FEI Inspect F50 (FSEM).Time-resolved photoluminescence (TRPL) was tested using FLSP920 (Edinburgh instrument) under an excitation wavelength of 375 nm and emission wavelength of 460 nm. Under the Xe lamp irradiation, the photoreduction of CO 2 was completed using a photocatalytic online analysis system (Perfect Light Labsolar 6A).Briefly, 30

using a Bruker D8 ADVANCE with CuKa as a radiation source at 10 Cmin.CO 2 -temperature-programmed desorptionmass spectroscopy (CO 2 -TPD-MS) was performed on AutoChem II 2920 (CO 2 -TPD) equipped with Cirrus 2 (MS).The temperature was raised to 800 C at a heating rate of 10 Cmin under He atmosphere.TOF-SIMS was achieved through ION TOF-SIMS 5. to 5 A 10 A9 MPa to remove air.Solid-state 13 C NMR spectra were obtained using a Bruker 400 MHz.Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images were obtained using FEI Tecnai G2 F20, with an accelerating voltage of 200 kV.Scanning TEM (STEM) images, high-resolution TEM (HRTEM) images, and energy dispersive spectrometry (EDS) were obtained using Tecnai G2 F20 S-Twin TMP.UV-visible diffuse reflectance spectra (UV-vis DRS) were obtained using a PE Lambda 650 s (UV-vis spectrophotometer) with scanning range of

The characteristics of transient photocurrent response and electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS) of the samples under Xe lamp irradiation were tested on

lamp irradiation were tested on an electrochemical workstation CHI660E (Shanghai Chenhua Co., Ltd., China) equipped with a three-electrode system.AgAgCl and Pt wire were used as reference and counter electrodes, respectively.The working electrode was prepared as follows: 30 mg polyethylene glycol and 30 mg sample were mixed and ground with 0.5 mL ethanol.The resulting slurry was coated on a conductive glass with a coating area of 1 cm 2 and then dried at 100 C for 2 h.The electrolyte was 0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 .

with scanning range of 250-800 nm.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was performed using Axis Supra.Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) images were captured using FEI Inspect F50 (FSEM).Time-resolved photoluminescence (TRPL) was tested using FLSP920 (Edinburgh instrument) under an excitation wavelength of 375 nm and emission wavelength of 460 nm. Under the Xe lamp irradiation, the photoreduction of CO 2 was completed using a photocatalytic online analysis system (Perfect Light Labsolar 6A).Briefly, 30

surrounding electrons through electronelectron or electron-phonon scattering, which activates the surrounding electrons and causes the local temperature rise 46.As shown in step 2, the hot electrons transferred energy to the electrons transferred from g-C 3 N 4 to the Au nanoparticles.The electrons were captured by the adsorbed CO 2 molecules and reacted with the H 2 O molecules present in the environment to generate CO and CH 4 (step 3).The activation of hot electrons increased the efficiency of

reaction of CO 2 47,48.The transient photocurrent response (Fig. 8d) and electrochemical impedance (inset of Fig. 8d) of CNAu and CN0 support the improved carrier separation and migration of CNAu.The photocurrent density of CNAu is higher than that of CN0 and the arc radius is smaller than that of CN0.This indicates that the carrier separation of CNAu is improved.49505152.Therefore, we confirmed that the Schottky junction in CNAu improves carrier migration, thereby improving the activity of CO 2
